title: Richard Madden swaps Bodyguard for modelling world as he films Calvin Klein ad
text:
Richard Madden may need a Bodyguard himself soon… (Picture: Splash)

Richard Madden has swapped The Bodyguard for the modelling world after being unveiled as the new face of Calvin Klein.

The 33-year-old was spotted getting into the spirit of things as he filmed an ad campaign for the brand, on the streets of London.

He looked dapper as he got in front of the camera, rocking the double denim with faded blue jeans and a matching jacket.

The actor – who has been tipped to be the next James Bond – finished the look off with a pair of chunky boots.

And he definitely stood out on the shoot, surrounded by countless models who all opted for a black jumper and dark jeans.

We’re not quite sure it’s a look 007 would ever go for…

Richard swapped Bodyguarding for the modelling world (Picture: Splash)

Richard became a household name after he starred in The Bodyguard last year, alongside Keeley Hawes.

Advertisement

Advertisement

He recently landed a part in upcoming Marvel flick, The Eternals, joining Angelina Jolie and Kit Harington on set.

But the star could be returning to his Bodyguarding best soon as Jed Mercurio has revealed talks for season two are ‘underway’.

Speaking at the Banff World Media Festival in Canada, the Line Of Duty creator admitted: ‘We’re in talks. We’re going through the logistics of it.’

Bring it on.

He’s been tipped for the James Bond role (Picture: Splash)

However, Richard recently opened up about playing David Budd, confessing the role left him ‘very isolated and broken’.

Which is not ideal…

‘It weighed very heavy on me,’ he told Hollywood Reporter.

‘You spend more time in someone else’s clothes, saying someone else’s words, thinking someone else’s thoughts. You do lose a bit of yourself.

‘I’m not a method actor in any way, but you get a huge hangover from this.

‘At the end of this, I felt very isolated and broken, much like the character was.’

Well, we hope The Bodyguard series two is a little more upbeat…
